chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall p q : Z, p > 0 -> q > 0 -> p <= q -> rel_prime p q -> distinct_parity p q -> ~ is_sqr (Z.mul p (Z.mul q (Z.sub (Z.mul q q) (Z.mul p p))))

Premises:
is_sqr = fun n : Z => 0 <= n /\ (exists i : Z, i * i = n /\ 0 <= i) : Z -> Prop Arguments is_sqr _%Z_scope
N.sub = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos n' => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos m' => match Pos.sub_mask n' m' with | Pos.IsPos p => N.pos p | _ => 0%N end end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.sub (_ _)%N_scope
rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
distinct_parity = fun a b : Z => Zeven a /\ Zodd b \/ Zodd a /\ Zeven b : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments distinct_parity (_ _)%Z_scope
prop4 : forall p q : Z, 0 <= p -> 0 <= q -> rel_prime p q -> is_sqr (p * q) -> is_sqr p /\ is_sqr q
relp_pq1 : forall p q : Z, p >= 0 -> p <= q -> rel_prime p q -> distinct_parity p q -> rel_prime (q * q - p * p) (p * p + q * q)
prop4b : forall p q : Z, 0 <= p -> 0 <= q -> p <= q -> rel_prime p q -> is_sqr (p * (q * (q * q - p * p))) -> is_sqr p /\ is_sqr q /\ is_sqr (q * q - p * p)
relp_pq2 : forall p q : Z, rel_prime p q -> distinct_parity p q -> rel_prime (2 * p * q) (p * p + q * q)
is_sqr_mult : forall p q : Z, is_sqr p -> is_sqr q -> is_sqr (p * q)
distp_neq : forall p q : Z, distinct_parity p q -> p <> q
cond_pqb = fun p q : Z => p >= 0 /\ q > 0 /\ p <= q /\ rel_prime p q : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments cond_pqb (_ _)%Z_scope
distp_sqr1 : forall p q : Z, distinct_parity p q -> distinct_parity (p * p) (q * q)
distp_sqr2 : forall p q : Z, distinct_parity (p * p) (q * q) -> distinct_parity p q
distp_odd : forall p q : Z, distinct_parity p q -> both_odd (p + q) (q - p)
cond_pq = fun p q : Z => cond_pqb p q /\ distinct_parity p q : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments cond_pq (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.add_lt_mono : forall n m p q : Z, n < m -> p < q -> n + p < m + q
pytha_set_even = fun a b c : Z => exists p q m : Z, a = m * (q * q - p * p) /\ b = 2 * m * (p * q) /\ c = m * (p * p + q * q) /\ m >= 0 /\ cond_pq p q : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments pytha_set_even (_ _ _)%Z_scope
pytha_set = fun a b c : Z => exists p q m : Z, (a = m * (q * q - p * p) /\ b = 2 * m * (p * q) \/ a = 2 * m * (p * q) /\ b = m * (q * q - p * p)) /\ c = m * (p * p + q * q) /\ m >= 0 /\ cond_pq p q : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments pytha_set (_ _ _)%Z_scope
Zmult_le_approx : forall n m p : Z, n > 0 -> n > p -> 0 <= m * n + p -> 0 <= m
Zdivide_intro : forall a b q : Z, b = q * a -> (a | b)
prime_rel_prime : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a : Z, ~ (p | a) -> rel_prime p a
Zmult_compare_compat_l : forall n m p : Z, p > 0 -> (n ?= m) = (p * n ?= p * m)
Z.le_trans : forall n m p : Z, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p
prime_ind : forall (p : Z) (P : Prop), (1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> P) -> prime p -> P
Z.mul_reg_l : forall n m p : Z, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m -> n = m
Z.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : Z, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
Z.lt_trans : forall n m p : Z, n < m -> m < p -> n < p
diophantus20_equiv : forall y z : Z, y > 0 -> z > 0 -> y <= z -> rel_prime y z -> distinct_parity y z -> ~ is_sqr ((z * z + y * y) * (z * z - y * y))
Inductive prime (p : Z) : Prop := prime_intro : 1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> prime p Arguments prime _%Z_scope Arguments prime_intro _%Z_scope _ _%function_scope
Zplus_lt_compat_r : forall n m p : Z, n < m -> n + p < m + p
Zplus_lt_compat_l : forall n m p : Z, n < m -> p + n < p + m
BinIntDef.Z.div = fun a b : Z => let (q, _) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in q : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.div (_ _)%Z_scope
prime_mult : forall p : Z, prime p -> forall a b : Z, (p | a * b) -> (p | a) \/ (p | b)
Pos2Z.is_nonneg : forall p : positive, 0 <= Z.pos p
